isis.stitle: TSI 06-12-04 - In-chassis Service Procedure: Removal and Installation of Branch Tube Assembly

subjectgroup.subject: In-chassis Service Procedure: Removal and Installation of Branch Tube Assembly

geninfo.para: This In-chassis Service Procedure allows removal of the branch tube assembly without removing the cylinder heads.

note.para: Photo illustrations in this TSI identify specific parts or assemblies that support text and procedures; other areas in photo illustrations may not be exact.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine has cooled before removing components.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner or wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

note.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel and coolant) are a threat to the environment. Do not put engine fluids in the trash, pour fluids on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, always disconnect main negative battery cable first. Always connect the main negative battery cable last.

step1.para: Disconnect negative battery cable and Electronic Control Module (ECM) ground.
Drain air tanks, if equipped.
Remove inside engine cover from truck, if equipped. See Truck Service Manual.
Remove the right inner fender well, if required.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Parts Identification (Engine In-chassis - 4100 truck)

step1.para: Remove air intake duct, air filter housing and mounting bracket.
Loosen CAC pipe clamps and remove CAC pipe.
Rotate belt tensioner clockwise to release belt tension and remove serpentine drive belts.
Remove alternator wiring and remove alternator assembly.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, do not open pressurized air conditioning lines.

step1.para: If truck is equipped with air conditioning, remove air conditioning compressor bolts from mounting bracket, but do not remove or disconnect pressurized air conditioning lines. Move compressor out of the way and secure with a strap.
Remove mounting bracket for alternator and air conditioning compressor.

If truck is equipped with an air compressor, remove coolant supply line and pinch off coolant flow. Remove two of three M10 air compressor mounting bracket bolts. Loosen third bolt and pivot or reposition air compressor out of the way.
If required to remove valve covers; remove oil dipstick, washer bottle, and bracket.
Loosen turbocharger exhaust clamp and remove exhaust down pipe from turbocharger exhaust flange.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Parts Identification

calloutgroup.callout1: V-clamp (Right exhaust tube to EGR cooler)
V-clamp (Shielded tube exhaust assembly to turbocharger)
Electronic Control Module (ECM) / Injector Drive Module (IDM)

step1.para: Loosen V-clamp connecting shielded tube exhaust assembly to turbocharger.
Loosen V-clamp connecting right exhaust tube to EGR cooler.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Air Management Parts

calloutgroup.callout1: V-clamp (Shielded tube exhaust assembly to turbocharger)

step1.para: Remove two M8 bolts and nuts connecting shielded tube exhaust assembly to left exhaust manifold.
Remove two M8 bolts and nuts connecting right exhaust tube to right exhaust manifold.
Leaving right exhaust tube attached, remove shielded tube exhaust assembly.
Remove three bolts from pump gasket heat shield and remove heat shield.
Unplug EGR drive module and remove module and mounting bracket.
Unplug ECM and IDM electrical connectors.
See Engine Service Manual - "Engine Electrical" to remove the following:
See Engine Service Manual - "Electronically Controlled Variable Geometry Turbocharger (VGT)" to remove the following:
Remove the high-pressure oil pump cover. See Engine Service Manual - "High-pressure Oil Pump".
See Engine Service Manual - "Cylinder Head and Valve Train" to remove the following:
See Tech Service FAQ 201054 (ISIS) to remove the following:

item.para: Rocker arm assemblies (intake and exhaust) for cylinders 7 and 8.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, use a suitable lifting device to support and lower transmission assembly.

step1.para: Remove transmission assembly.
Remove clutch assembly, if equipped with a manual transmission.
See Engine Service Manual - "Rear Cover, Flywheel, and Power Steering Gear Drive" to remove the following:
Remove two M10 x 30 power steering and fuel pump assembly bolts and support the power steering and fuel pump assembly.
Disconnect starter motor assembly wiring. Remove M10 starter motor bolts and remove the starter motor assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Removal of through bolt from rear engine mount in chassis mounting bracket

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, use a chain hoist rated for the weight of the engine, follow manufacturer's installation and safety instructions, and attach safety latch lifting hooks to lifting eyes on the engine.

step1.para: Attach a hoist to support the engine.
Remove two M16 through bolts and nuts from rear engine mounts.
Raise engine with a hoist and support engine with a jack.
Remove eight M12 bolts from rear engine mounting brackets and remove brackets from rear cover.
Remove wiring retaining clips from rear cover assembly, if required.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Rear cover mounting bolts

step1.para: Remove rear cover mounting bolts marked A and C in figure.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, use a suitable lifting device or get help to lower rear cover.

step1.para: Loosen rear cover mounting bolts marked B, but do not remove.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage when removing the rear cover, avoid pulling out gasket between the upper and lower crankcase.

step1.para: Use a thin gasket scraper to separate sealant between the upper and lower crankcase and the rear cover assembly.
Remove rear cover mounting bolts marked B and remove rear cover.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Sealant at upper and lower crankcase

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, cut sealant at upper and lower crankcase.

step1.para: Remove remaining sealant from upper crankcase, lower crankcase and rear cover, using a sharp gasket scraper or putty knife.
Remove intake and exhaust pushrods from cylinders 7 and 8.
Remove exhaust pushrod from cylinder 6.
Attach a No. 27 torx bit to a 1/4 x 10 inch extension.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Extension in pushrod hole

step1.para: Look through back of crankcase and insert extension through exhaust pushrod hole for cylinder 6 and push torx bit into M6 x 40 torx head bolt in block of branch tube assembly.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not drop mounting bolts into crankcase.

step1.para: Carefully loosen torx head bolt to allow removal.
Remove extension from pushrod hole.
Look through back of crankcase and use a magnet to carefully remove torx head bolt in one of three ways:

item.para: Magnet inserted through hole for crankcase-to-head tube
Magnet inserted through back of crankcase

step1.para: Insert extension through exhaust pushrod hole for cylinder 7 and push torx bit into M6 x 40 torx head bolt in block of branch tube assembly.
Repeat steps 46 through 48.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Removal of bolts from branch tube adaptor

step1.para: Remove two M6 x 30 bolts connecting branch tube adapter to branch tube assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 9. Removal of branch tube adapter

step1.para: Remove branch tube adapter, using a No.10 quick release tool - ZTSE4581 and discard branch tube adapter.

figure.caption: Figure 10. Removal of O-ring

step1.para: Remove O-ring from recess in branch tube assembly and discard O-ring.

figure.caption: Figure 11. High-pressure oil pump assembly and STC fitting

step1.para: Remove STC fitting and discard.
Remove branch tube assembly and discard.

figure.caption: Figure 12. High-pressure oil pump assembly and STC fitting

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, a new STC fitting must be installed.

step1.para: Install a new STC fitting for the high-pressure oil pump.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not over tighten the STC fitting; if over tightened, the STC fitting will fail.

step1.para: Torque new STC fitting to 53 ± 4 N·m (39 ± 3 lbf·ft).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Mounting block on branch tube assembly

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, a new branch tube assembly must be installed.

step1.para: Grease each M6 x 40 torx head bolt and insert into mounting blocks of new branch tube assembly.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not drop mounting bolts into crankcase.

step1.para: Position new branch tube assembly for mounting in crankcase.

figure.caption: Figure 14. Installation of O-ring

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, a new O-ring must be installed.

step1.para: Install new O-ring in the recess of the branch tube assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 15. Installation of bolts for branch tube adapter

step1.para: Install and loosely tighten two M6 x 30 mounting bolts to connect new branch tube adapter to branch tube assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Extension in pushrod hole

step1.para: Look through back of crankcase, insert extension - with No. 27 torx bit attached - through exhaust pushrod hole for cylinder 6, and install and loosely tighten M6 x 40 torx head bolt.
Look through back of crankcase, insert extension - with No. 27 torx bit attached - through exhaust pushrod hole for cylinder 7, and install and loosely tighten M6 x 40 torx head bolt.
Torque both M6 x 40 torx head bolts to 13 N·m (115 lbf·in).
Torque both M6 x 30 mounting bolts for the branch tube adaptor to 13 N·m (115 lbf·in).
Install exhaust pushrod for cylinder 6.
Install intake and exhaust pushrods for cylinders 7 and 8.
See Tech Service FAQ 201054 (ISIS) to install the following:

item.para: Rocker arm assemblies (intake and exhaust) for cylinders 7 and 8.

step1.para: See Engine Service Manual - "Cylinder Head and Valve Train" to install the following:
Install high-pressure oil pump cover. See Engine Service Manual - "High-pressure Oil Pump".

figure.caption: Figure 17. Air Management Parts

calloutgroup.callout1: V-clamp (Shielded tube exhaust assembly to turbocharger)

step1.para: Position pump gasket heat shield and install three bolts finger tight.
Torque two M6 x 12 heat shield bolts to 13 N·m (115 lbf·in) and torque one M10 x 16 heat shield bolt to 62 N·m (45 lbf·ft).
Position shielded exhaust tube assembly on engine with right exhaust tube and EGR cooler gasket attached. Install four M8 exhaust bolts and nuts finger tight to secure assembly to exhaust manifolds.
Position V-clamp to connect shielded tube exhaust assembly to turbocharger and torque V-clamp to 12 N·m (9 lbf·ft).
Position V-clamp to connect right exhaust tube to EGR cooler and torque V-clamp to 6 N·m (4 lbf·ft).
Torque M8 bolts securing shielded exhaust tube assembly (right exhaust tube attached) to 27 ± 4 N·m (20 ± 3 lbf·ft).
See Engine Service Manual - "Rear Cover, Flywheel, and Power Steering Gear Drive" for installation of the following:

item.para: Power steering and fuel pump assembly

step1.para: Reinstall wiring clips on rear cover, if necessary.
Install rear engine mounting brackets on the rear cover assembly and torque eight M12 x 40 bolts to 107 N·m (79 lbf·ft).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Installation of through bolt into rear engine mount

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the lifting hoist and hooks are secure - before lowering the engine.

step1.para: Lower engine to set rear engine mounting brackets in chassis mounting brackets.
Install two M16 through bolts and nuts to secure rear engine mounts to chassis mounting brackets. Torque nuts to 294-325 N·m (216-239 lbf·ft).
Remove chain hoist.
Install starter motor assembly and torque M10 x 40 starter bolts to 47-58 N·m (35-43 lbf·ft). Reconnect starter wiring.
Install clutch and pressure plate, if equipped with a manual transmission.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, use a suitable lifting device to support and raise transmission assembly.

step1.para: Install transmission assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Parts Identification

calloutgroup.callout1: V-clamp (Right exhaust tube to EGR cooler)
V-clamp (Shielded tube exhaust assembly to turbocharger)
Electronic Control Module (ECM) / Injector Drive Module (IDM)

step1.para: See Engine Service Manual- "Electronically Controlled Variable Geometry Turbocharger (VGT)" to install the following:
Install exhaust down pipe onto turbocharger exhaust flange and torque exhaust clamp to 5-10 N·m (4-8 lbf·ft).
See Engine Service Manual - "Engine Electrical" to install the following:

item.para: Electronic Control Module (ECM), Injector Driver Module (IDM), and mounting bracket.

step1.para: Plug in ECM and IDM electrical connectors.
Install EGR drive module with mounting bracket and plug in electrical connector.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Parts Identification - Engine In-chassis (4100 truck)

step1.para: Install oil dipstick, washer bottle and bracket, if removed.
Install alternator and air conditioning compressor mounting bracket and torque M10 bolts to 62 N·m (45 lbf·ft).
Install alternator and reconnect alternator wiring.
If removed, install air conditioning compressor.
If removed, install air compressor and mounting bracket. Torque three M10 x 100 air compressor mounting bracket bolts to 62 N·m (45 lbf·ft). Reconnect air compressor coolant line.
Install serpentine drive belts.
Install CAC pipe and tighten clamps.
Install air intake duct, air filter housing and mounting bracket.
Install right inner fender well, if removed.
Install inside engine cover in truck, if equipped. See Truck Service Manual.
Reconnect Electronic Control Module (ECM) ground and negative battery cable.
